g.text: Uber is a ride-sharing platform that connects passengers with drivers who offer transportation services in personal vehicles. It allows users
to book rides on-demand from their smartphones, matching them with a nearby driver who will take them from their location
1. Riders should be able to input a start location and a destination and get a fare estimate
2. Riders should be able to request a ride based on the estimated fare
3. Drivers should be able to accept/decline a request and navigate to pickup/drop-off
- 100M daily active users, 15M rides per day
1. Low latency matching riders to drivers (< 1 min)
2. Consistency over availability when matching to ensure only one driver is assigned to a single rider.
3. High availability to ensure we can handle large bursts of matching requests within a given region. (100k / region)
- encode lat and long as string -> sorted set to index values
